lines.content: > Hello World, the Real King James is in the Building "Finally".  My Brother [@oneandonlycp3](https://x.com/OneAndOnlyCp3)
gas'd me up to jump on board so I'm here. Haaaa - A real [tweet](https://x.com/KingJames/status/17893326147) from LeBron James
The 4-time NBA Champion, MVP and Finals MVP is now here to help you stay on track to achieve greatness. He is:
Simply do the following to let the King take charge:
We have also taught the King some Java too! Here's the `main` method he has whipped up so far:

// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* Entry point for the LeBot task manager.
* Shows an intro, creates a {@link TaskList}, and then reads user
* input in a loop, dispatching commands until the user exits with {@code bye}.
* Continuously reads a line of user input, parses it into a {@link Command} object,
* and delegates to {@link #dispatchAction(Command, TaskList)} until that method
* @param list the task list to read from and mutate based on user commands
* Executes the action contained in the parsed command.

*
  • {@code mark} / {@code unmark} — toggle completion on a task

*
  • {@code todo}, {@code deadline}, {@code event} — add a task
* Any unknown action results in an "invalid input" message.
* @param parsedInput the parsed user input containing an action and optional description
* @param list        the task list to operate on
* @return {@code true} to continue the loop; {@code false} to exit
private static boolean dispatchAction(Command parsedInput, TaskList list) {
* Entry point for the LeBot task manager.
* Shows an intro, creates a {@link TaskList}, and then reads user
* input in a loop, dispatching commands until the user exits with {@code bye}.
* Executes the action contained in the parsed command.

*
  • {@code mark} / {@code unmark} — toggle completion on a task

*
  • {@code todo}, {@code deadline}, {@code event} — add a task
* Any unknown action results in an "invalid input" message.
* @param parsedInput the parsed user input containing an action and optional description
* @param list        the task list to operate on
* @return Confirmation message for display on GUI
public static String dispatchAction(Command parsedInput, TaskList list) {
* Parses and represents a user command consisting of an action and an optional description.
* The first whitespace-separated token is treated as the action
* of the line—if any—is stored as the description. If only one token
* is provided, the description is the empty string.
* Constructs a {@code Command} by splitting the input on whitespace.
* @param input the raw user input line
* Equality is based only on the action:

*
  • If {@code obj} is a {@link Command}, returns {@code true} when both actions are equal.

*
  • If {@code obj} is a {@link String}, returns {@code true} when it equals this action.
* @param obj the object to compare with
* @return whether {@code obj} matches this command's action
* Returns the command action (the first token).
* Returns the command description (everything after the action), or
* the empty string if none was provided.
* Stores tasks in {@code data/lebot.LeBot.txt} as one line per task using a
* A value of {@code 1} means done; {@code 0} means not done.
* On save, parent directories are created if needed and the file is truncated.
* On load, a missing file results in an empty list. I/O errors are reported via {@link Ui}.
private static final Path DEFAULT_PATH = Path.of("data/lebot.LeBot.txt");
* Persists the given list of tasks to disk at {@code data/lebot.LeBot.txt}.
* The file is created if it does not exist and truncated if it does.
* Any {@link IOException} is caught and reported via {@link Ui#showIoError(String)}.
* Each line is parsed into a {@link ToDo}, {@link Deadline}, or {@link Event}
* based on the leading type code ({@code T}, {@code D}, {@code E}). If the
* file is not found, an empty list is returned.
* @return a list of tasks reconstructed from disk; never {@code null}
case "E" -> task = new Event(tempList[2], tempList[4], tempList[5]);
* A deadline task with a single due date.
* Extends {@link Task} by storing a due date and adding a {@code D} type tag
* to its display and storage formats.
* Creates a deadline with the given description and due date.

*

Date string must be in the format {@code dd/MM/yyyy} (e.g., {@code 03/11/2025}).
* @param due  due date string in {@code dd/MM/yyyy} format
* @throws java.time.format.DateTimeParseException if the date string cannot be parsed
* Returns a string with the deadline type tag and due date.
* Date is shown as {@code MMM d yyyy}, e.g., {@code Jan 1 2025}.
* @return a string like {@code "[D][ ] Submit report (by: Jan 1 2025)"}
* @return the serialized representation of this deadline
* An event task with a start and end date.
* Extends {@link Task} by storing a date range and adding an {@code E} type tag
* to its display and storage formats.
* Creates an event with the given description and date range.

*

Date strings must be in the format {@code dd/MM/yyyy} (e.g., {@code 03/12/2025}).
* @param to   end date string in {@code dd/MM/yyyy} format
* @param from start date string in {@code dd/MM/yyyy} format
* @throws java.time.format.DateTimeParseException if either date string cannot be parsed
public Event(String desc, String to, String from) {
* Returns a string with the event type tag and date range.
* Dates are shown as {@code MMM d yyyy}, e.g., {@code Jan 1 2025}.
* @return a string like {@code "[E][ ] Basketball Bootcamp (from: Jan 1 2025 to: Jan 3 2025)"}
* @return the serialized representation of this event
* Base class for all tasks with a text description and a completion flag.
* This class is extended by {@link Deadline}, {@link Event}, and {@link ToDo}.
* Provides helpers to mark/unmark completion, show a status icon,
* and format itself as a string for display and storage.
* Returns a status icon for display.
* Adds a tag to the tag list.
* @param tag the tag name for the task
* Returns a string combining the status icon and description.
*     Subclasses extend this format to include their task type, like [T] for {@link ToDo}.
* @return a string like {@code "[ ] Lose"} or {@code "[✓] Win the Finals"}
* Returns a string for storage purposes, delimited by |.
* Uses {@code "1"} for done and {@code "0"} for not done.
* Subclasses extend this format to append their own fields, like task Type and DateTime fields.
* Returns a string of tags for display purposes.
* Subclasses use this method to append to the end.
* Returns a string of tags for saving purposes.
* @return a string in the form {@code tag1\tag2}
* Mutable list of {@link Task} objects with helpers for creating,
* updating, and deleting tasks based on user input.
* Persists changes via {@link Storage} and reports outcomes via {@link Ui}.
private static final Pattern DEADLINE_BY = Pattern.compile("/by (\\S+)");
private static final Pattern EVENT_TO = Pattern.compile("/to (\\S+)");
private static final Pattern EVENT_FROM = Pattern.compile("/from (\\S+)");
* Loads the task list from persistent storage (default: data/LeBot.txt).
* Creates a task list backed by the provided list (no copy is made).
* @param list the underlying list of tasks
* Converts a 1-based index string (e.g., from user input) to a 0-based index.
* @param desc the 1-based index as a string
* @throws NumberFormatException if {@code desc} is not a valid integer
* Finds the first regex group match in the given text.
* @return the first captured group if found; {@code null} otherwise
private static String findGroup(Pattern pattern, String text) {
* Returns whether the list has no tasks.
* Gets the task at a 0-based index.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if {@code index} is out of range
* Marks the task at the 1-based index given by {@code desc} as done.
* Saves the list and shows feedback via {@link Ui}.
* Handles invalid numbers or out-of-bounds indices by showing error messages.
* Marks the task at the 1-based index given by {@code desc} as not done.
* Saves the list and shows feedback via {@link Ui}.
* Handles invalid numbers or out-of-bounds indices by showing error messages.
* Adds a task, saves the list, and shows a confirmation.
* Deletes the task at the 1-based index given by {@code desc}.
* Saves the list and shows feedback via {@link Ui}.
* Handles invalid numbers or out-of-bounds indices by showing error messages.
* Creates and adds a {@link ToDo} from the given description.
* If the description is empty, shows an error via {@link Ui}.
* Creates and adds a {@link Deadline} parsed from the description.
* Shows errors via {@link Ui} if the date is missing or invalid.
* @param desc full user input containing description and {@code /by} date
Deadline deadline = new Deadline(desc.replace("/by " + match, ""), match);
* Creates and adds an {@link Event} parsed from the description.
* Expected format includes both {@code /from dd/MM/yyyy} and {@code /to dd/MM/yyyy}, e.g.:
* Shows errors via {@link Ui} if dates are missing or invalid.
* @param desc full user input containing description, {@code /from}, and {@code /to} dates
Event event = new Event(newDesc, to, from);
* Finds the tasks containing a given keyword and displays them.
* Adds a specified tag to the task.
* @param input command consisting of index and tag.
* A simple to-do task with only a description and completion status.
* A concrete {@link Task} subtype with the type tag {@code T}.
* Returns a string with the to-do type tag [T].
* @return a string like {@code "[T][ ] Win"} or {@code "[T][✓] Win"}
* Returns a string for storage. Appends type tag T to {@link Task}'s formattedString() method.
* Format: {@code T|<0-or-1>|<description>} where {@code 1} means done and {@code 0} means not done.
* @return the serialized representation of this to-do
* Represents a dialog box consisting of an ImageView to represent the speaker's face
* and a label containing text from the speaker.
* Flips the dialog box such that the ImageView is on the left and text on the right.
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
public static DialogBox getDukeDialog(String text, Image img) {
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
private final LeBotGui leBot = new LeBotGui();
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* Simple class to handle command line output.
*     Returns pre-configured strings. Each individual method is trivial.
return "Yo, what’s good! It's LeBot James in the building! What can I help you with today? Let's get it!";
* Formats and returns a string of all tasks in a given TaskList
* @return the string of all tasks. Custom string is returned if TaskList is empty
return "Haven’t added anything yet? Can’t win a game if you don’t put the ball in play. "
+ "Gotta set the goals before you chase them.";
sb.append("Here’s the list. No excuses, no shortcuts. One by one, we knock these down.");
* Formats and returns a string of found tasks
* @param tasks the filtered list of tasks
* @return the string of all tasks. Custom string is returned if TaskList is empty
return "Scouting report: no matching tasks on your list. Reset, refocus, run it back.";
sb.append("Game plan update: here are the matching tasks in your list.");
public static String showAdd(Task task, int size) {
return "Got it. Next task on the list: \n" + task + "\n" + size + " tasks on the board. Lock in.";
* Formats and returns a string of all tasks in a given TaskList
* @param size the number of tasks after deletion
public static String showDelete(Task task, int size) {
return "Scratched it off the list. Recenter yourself: "
+ task + "\n" + "Now you have " + size + " tasks on the board.";
return "Checked it off the list. Another step closer to greatness: " + task;
return "Alright, not done yet. Back in the lab, time to finish the job: " + task;
return "Ayy, take care! Hope to see you soon! Stay blessed.";
return "Invalid input? Happens. Adjust, refocus, try again. That’s how you grow.";
return "Enter a real number... locked in, focused. No shortcuts, just the truth.";
return "Out of bounds?? Gotta stay within the limits, stay disciplined. Fundamentals matter.";
return "lebot.tasks.ToDo cannot be empty. Gotta put the ball in play.";
return "No deadline set, can't achieve greatness like that.";
return "Gotta specify a time window. Eyes on the prize.";
return "Shoot me the date like this, champ: dd/MM/yyyy.";
